title: HTTPZen - Terminal HTTP Client
description: A terminal-based HTTP client to interact with APIs from your terminal. It supports various HTTP methods, benchmarking, and more, making it a powerful tool for developers and API testers.

features.title: Why httpzen?
features.subtitle: Fast, ergonomic and made for power users.
features.fast-desc: Low overhead and instant feedback for your API workflows.
features.bench-desc: Built-in benchmarking to compare endpoints and measure latency.
features.inspect-desc: Inspect requests, responses, headers and network details.
features.iplookup-desc: Look up your IP and related network information quickly.
features.shortcuts-desc: Navigate with handy keyboard shortcuts to speed up tasks.
features.pretty-desc: Readable, colorized output for JSON and common payloads.

install.title: Quick start
install.subtitle: Download a package for your distro or the standalone binary.

binary.title: Binary
binary.desc: Standalone executable for any Linux distro.

deb.title: Debian/Ubuntu (.deb)
deb.desc: Install with apt on Debian-based distros.

rpm.title: Fedora/RHEL (.rpm)
rpm.desc: Install with dnf/yum on RPM-based distros.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Read the usage guide, flags and advanced workflows.
